data.title: Pleasantly Surprised
data.text: I think most sandwich shops are alike.  It's hard to find something different.  It was our first visit to a Quiznos and I have to say it was a really good sandwich.  I had the Italian.  I saw a posting in which someone said it was expensive.  Well, make a visit to CA and return to Denver or just eat on an aircraft.  I am sure you will find it couldn't be further from the truth.  Whether one might think it's expensive, everyone has their own thought in that regard.  As advertised, under $10 should give anyone a good clue on what to expect to pay.  We used the one at the airport and I didn't see it posted on this site.  I couldn't get an address for the location.  If your looking for a quick in and out, I recommend it.

data.title: Lunch after money
data.text: After touring the Denver Mint, the wife needed a bite to eat. Conveniently, Quiznos was across the street on this chilly morning. We were greeted with a smile by the owner and placed our sandwich orders. The prompt and friendly service was appreciated and the wife was in a better place after her meal. Thanks guys n Gals for starting our day off on the right foot. If downtown, grab a bite at Quiznos, you won't be disappointed.

data.title: Colorado original - favorite lunch spot
data.text: The Quiznos chain was started in Denver.  It is, by far, my favorite sandwich/salad place.  They have a variety of fresh options.  You don't have to have all the bread.  Any sandwich can be made as a salad.
